ru.jango.j0loader.image.cache

Interface Cache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCache, LRUCache

    public interface Cache

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Fully clears the cache (both images data and scales).
      int count()
      Returns number of elements in cache.
      byte[] get(java.net.URI uri)
      Pulls an image data from the cache, if it was previously cached.
      long getMaxCacheSize()
      Returns max allowed cache size in bytes.
      android.graphics.Point getScale(java.net.URI uri)
      Returns previously remembered scale, or NULL.
      boolean hasScale(java.net.URI uri)
      Checks if scale was previously set for the specified image.
      boolean isCached(java.net.URI uri)
      Checks if an image was previously cached.
      boolean put(java.net.URI uri, byte[] raw)
      Adds a chunk of data into cache.
      byte[] remove(java.net.URI uri)
      Removes an image from cache.
      android.graphics.Point removeScale(java.net.URI uri)
      Removes scale for the specified image.
      android.graphics.Point resolveScale(java.net.URI uri, byte[] loadedData)
      Returns appropriate scale for just loaded image.
      int scalesCount()
      Returns number of remembered scales.
      void setMaxCacheSize(long maxCacheSize)
      Sets max allowed cache size in bytes.
      void setScale(java.net.URI uri, android.graphics.Point scale)
      Sets scale for the specified image.
      long size()
      Returns full cache size in bytes (sum of all elements' sizes).

    • Method Detail

      • put

        boolean put(java.net.URI uri,
          byte[] raw)
        Adds a chunk of data into cache. Also checks cache size limits before adding. Method is called just after processing (loading and scaling) of next queue element.
        Parameters:
        uri - key URI to retrieve data later
        raw - an image compressed into a byte array
        Returns:
        TRUE if an data was put into cache; FALSE if cache is full - max cache size was reached

      • get

        byte[] get(java.net.URI uri)
        Pulls an image data from the cache, if it was previously cached. Method is called when loading from cache.
        Returns:
        previously cached image data, or NULL
        See Also:
        BitmapFactory.decodeByteArray(byte[], int, int)

      • remove

        byte[] remove(java.net.URI uri)
        Removes an image from cache.
        Returns:
        just removed image data, or NULL

      • isCached

        boolean isCached(java.net.URI uri)
        Checks if an image was previously cached. Method is called to find out what loading should be performed: loading from cache, or from URI.

      • size

        long size()
        Returns full cache size in bytes (sum of all elements' sizes).

      • count

        int count()
        Returns number of elements in cache.

      • getMaxCacheSize

        long getMaxCacheSize()
        Returns max allowed cache size in bytes.

      • setMaxCacheSize

        void setMaxCacheSize(long maxCacheSize)
        Sets max allowed cache size in bytes.

      • setScale

        void setScale(java.net.URI uri,
            android.graphics.Point scale)
        Sets scale for the specified image. It doesn't manage the cache itself - just saves the scale. Method is called while adding a new request into queue.

      • getScale

        android.graphics.Point getScale(java.net.URI uri)
        Returns previously remembered scale, or NULL.

      • resolveScale

        android.graphics.Point resolveScale(java.net.URI uri,
                                  byte[] loadedData)
        Returns appropriate scale for just loaded image. Not only returns previously saved scale, but also applies some checks. For example, checks max texture size limits for second parameter. Method is called during postprocessing an image just before scaling.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of an image
        loadedData - just loaded not scaled image data
        Returns:
        final image scale, or NULL (that means image shouldn't be scaled)

      • hasScale

        boolean hasScale(java.net.URI uri)
        Checks if scale was previously set for the specified image.

      • removeScale

        android.graphics.Point removeScale(java.net.URI uri)
        Removes scale for the specified image.

      • scalesCount

        int scalesCount()
        Returns number of remembered scales.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Fully clears the cache (both images data and scales).
